hierarchy.file_name: Impact--[BUG][Ticket 4/5] Wire inline positioning template edits to save/update via segment-scoped API.docx

sections.text:
This change connects the inline “positioning template” editor to the segment-scoped CRUD API so edits made in the UI are actually persisted per segment. Today, users can make changes inline but can’t reliably save them in a way that reflects segment-specific behavior, which undermines trust and creates rework when templates revert or differ from what’s expected.

With this wiring in place, users will be able to edit a segment’s positioning template, save to create/update the segment-scoped configuration, or cancel to discard changes. The editor will correctly track “dirty” state and reset it after save/cancel, reducing accidental overwrites and making it clear when there are unsaved changes.

The experience will include robust feedback and error handling: server-side validation errors will be surfaced in the UI (inline where relevant), and users will get clear success/failure feedback via toasts and/or inline messaging. After a successful save, the UI will refresh from the server response to ensure the displayed template exactly matches what was persisted.

Importantly, this maintains expected defaults: if a segment has no custom template, the UI will continue to show the default template rather than forcing an empty state or implicitly creating a customization. This preserves current behavior while enabling intentional segment-level overrides, improving consistency and confidence for users managing multiple segments.
